name: Easy Is That a Fragrance or a Stench? Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
fragrance.

	The word "fragrance" makes most people think of good smells.

questions.text: Yuck! What's that terrible _______? Didn't you take out the garbage yet?
questions.explanation:
stench.

	A stench is a bad smell.

questions.text: What word would you use to describe a thin person who looks GOOD?
questions.explanation:
slender.

	You could also say, "She looks nice and slim in that outfit."

questions.text: That lamp gives off a nice, soft _______.
questions.explanation:
glow.

	To glow is to give off soft, steady light.

questions.text: The pool water felt _______ and refreshing on my skin.
questions.explanation:
cool.

	Frigid and freezing have about the same meaning, which is for something to be very cold.

questions.text: The freshly washed bedsheets felt nice and _______.
questions.explanation:
smooth.

	Most people don't want to sleep in slimy, damp, or squishy sheets!

questions.text: Which word would you use to describe a good-tasting food?
questions.explanation:
savory.

	One of the meanings of the word savory is good-tasting.

questions.text: Please be quiet! I can't listen to that terrible _______ any more!
questions.explanation:
din.

	A din is a loud, unpleasant noise.

questions.text: The house was painted a lovely, _______ shade of yellow.
questions.explanation:
sunny.

	This quiz is meant to show that words like sunny, melodious, and fragrance suggest good feelings, while words like bony, din, and slimy suggest bad feelings.
